items.title: Upstream OBS Patches to 1.3.0
items.body:
This diff upstreams three patches used to make OBS build across various unixen

1. Add -Wno-date-time to gcc (supress-errors.patch)
2. Add cstdint to cpufeatures (include-cstdint.patch)
3. Make the xt tests optional under SURGE_BUILD_TESTRUNNER (will allow us to retire disable-tests.patch if we add -DSURGE_BUILD_TESTRUNNER=FALSE to the build command)

items.title: Docker Image back to gcc9
items.body: gcc11 had libcxx too high a version

items.title: Fix MSEG draw error on when tick 0 < 0.1
items.body:
For some reason we only drew ticks abouve 0.1 in the MSEG canvas. No comment, no reason, nothign breaks if we remove it but having it there causes #7453

So don't do that.

Closes #7453

items.title: Only run the Docker PR on PR
items.body: This restores the quick-to-nightly behavior of code-qual splitwq

items.title: Minor MSEG graphical bug

labels.name: UI
labels.description: Issues related to UI look&feel

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

items.body:
**Bug Description:**
MSEG doesn't show left-most vertical snap lines, 
when on a horizontal division above 10 when in LFO mode.

**Surge XT Version**
Surge XT 1.3.0.20a8e16

* Version: 2023-12-08 @ 12:55:35 on 'fv-az390-357/pipeline' with 'MSVC-19.37.32826.1' using JUCE 7.0.5
* Plugin Type: VST3
* Bitness: 64-bit

**Reproduction Steps:**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. On an LFO, select the MSEG.
2. Click on the screen to bring up the editor.
3. Set the Horizontal to anything above 10.
4. Set 'Edit Mode' to LFO.
5. Left most line will have disappeared.

**Expected Behavior:**
The left most lines can be useful for sharp attacks.

**Screenshots:**
![image](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/assets/55408938/c5d5e731-9597-4423-ba03-2b2802c577f0)
![image](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/assets/55408938/7abda6b7-c1a4-4329-969c-95952dc2bf65)

**Computer Information (please complete the following!):**
 - OS: Windows 10
 - Host: Reaper
 - Version: 7.09

**Additional Information:**
N/A

items.title: Linux U18 docker build
items.body: Will require a few pushes I bet.

items.title: Swapping/Moving FX preserves modulation muting
items.body: Moving an FX keeps the modulation intact but when coding the swap/undo last night I realized that the move didn't keep mute intact. This fixes that bug.

items.title: Undo FX restores cleared modulation
items.body: Closes #7449

items.title: Changing FX (and clearing modulation) doesn't push modulation to undo stack

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

items.body:
Merge #7448 
set up a flanger and modulate it
change it to a chorus
undo

the flanger is back but the modulation isnt

basically push the applied modulations to the UndoFX in pushFX and so on.

items.title: FX Change Mod Clear fixed (broke iwth index introduction)
items.body:
The signature clange of clearModulation led to a mistake due to casting and defaults

Closes #7395

items.title: Osc work
items.body:
- OSC out IP address is settable
- OSC out for Parameters give true float values
- /q/all_mods implemented
- many small improvements

items.title: Drain the osc ring buf without audio
items.body:
When audio isn't running the osc ring buf just fills up. Like we do with other things use the audio processing active bool to drain on the osc thread. There's a tiny race condition if you are processing an osc message while you turn on audio but leave that edge-case-of-an-edge-case in a comment

Closes #7445

items.title: OSC ring buffer not drained when audio is absent

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

items.body:
**Bug Description:**
When audio output is off, processBlock() is not called, which means the OSC ring buffer is not processed.
 This makes it look as though the part of OSC that passes messages to the audio engine is not working.
**Surge XT Version**
current dev versions

items.title: Dleay Effect gets ms readouts; Upgrade basic-blocks and effects
items.body:
basic-blocks param metadata gets ability to have rescaled below a point. The delay picks this up automatically since we applied it to all envelope time types.

Closes #7424

items.title: Fix off-by-one display in Tuning Scale Rotation display
items.body:
The scale rotation display showed the right note number but the wrong interval. Fix that.

Closes #7416

items.title: Tuning Editor Keyboard can also play notes
items.body:
Forever and a day that keyboard table layout of frequencies has been sitting there, wanting to be pressed to play a note. But in the time we've had it noone thought of it until VincyZed suggested it.

Anyway bit more of a refactor than I thought since the juce tablelistboxmodel thing is very opinionated so needed to factor to a custom component etc... but also usefully adds a ui safe play and release note method to SurgeGUIEditor

Closes #7365

items.title: Fix error in b611a81; Restore sin negative feedback
items.body:
My fix to remove clicks also removed negative feedback! Anyway this change makes the correct change; linterp feedback postiive to negative and apply the abs on a per-sample basis for feedback transitions.

Addresses #7353

items.title: Modulator retriggers obey "from current"/"piano mode"
items.body:
In "from current" and "piano mode" envelopes retrigger continously so now the modulators (MSEG, Formula, Step Sequencer) follow that logic also

Closes #7360

items.title: Sine OSC Feedback Modulation Fix
items.body:
The Sin OSC feedback evaluated whether feedback was negative per block not per sample, making it somewhat discontinuous when modulated.

Addresses #7353

items.title: Refresh solo button on OSC Message
items.body:
The solo button is non-local and so requires a rebuild when it changes. The various mechanisms we have do this but OSC did not. So start a list of param types which when OSC set push a rebuild and add solo, mute, and scenesel all to them.

Closes #7417

items.title: Add Bluetooth Permission Text and Permission to XT/FX
items.body:
This should in tehory address #7429

Lets see!

items.title: Integrate Superparasites Clouds Firmware (off by default)
items.body:
This commit implements the superparasites firmware as an option for clouds. The firmware comes from patrick dowling at https://github.com/patrickdowling/superparasites

In this commit, the firmware is activatable at build time but is still off by default, so the synth is unchanged unless you opt in in libs/eurorack/CMakeLists with the option.

Closes https://github.com/patrickdowling/superparasites/issues/6 Addresses #7359

items.title: Undo on TypeIn and Mod TypeIn
items.body:
Amazingly, we didn't push an undo on param set via typein or param mod set via typein. How did we not find this for so long!

Closes #7433

items.title: Allow 32 bit linux to fail late, rather than early
items.body:
32 bit linux buidls fo surge mainline fail so we fatal error them early. Some folks want to do builds as a submoudle so make it fail late as an option, which is off by default.

Addresses https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge-rack/issues/975

items.title: How do I send OSC output to a remote tablet?
items.body:
My apologies if this is documented somewhere but I've searched and can't find anything.  I'm trying to create a TouchOSC template for Surge XT and I can only seem to get OSC output (i.e. /q/all_params) to TouchOSC if it's running on the same computer as the synth.  I can only find OSC input and Output port settings but not an output IP address setting.   It appears that all output goes to 127.0.0.1. 

Here's the version info from Surge XT:

Version: Surge XT 1.3.0.20a8e16
Build: 2023-12-08 @ 12:56:16 on 'Mac-1702036315614.local/pipeline' with 'AppleClang-14.0.0.14000029' using JUCE 7.0.5
System: macOS 64-bit Standalone on Intel(R) Core(TM) i9-9880H CPU @ 2.30GHz
Sample Rate: 48.0 kHz / Process block size: 32 samples

        swell: dlopen() failed: /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libm.so.6: version `GLIBC_2.35' not found (required by /usr/lib/vst3/Surge XT Effects.vst3/Contents/x86_64-linux/Surge XT Effects.so)

items.body:
## Bug Description:
Pressing the bluetooth midi button crashes Surge on Mac OS.

## Surge XT Version
Version: 1.3.0.20a8e16
Plugin Type: Standalone
Bitness: 64-bit

## Reproduction Steps:
Go to settings, press the bluetooth midi button.

## Computer Information (please complete the following!):

## Additional Information:
The crash reporter helpfully indicates that:
```
Termination Reason:    Namespace TCC, Code 0 
This app has crashed because it attempted to access privacy-sensitive data without a usage description. 
The app's Info.plist must contain an NSBluetoothAlwaysUsageDescription key with a string value explaining
to the user how the app uses this data.
```

items.title: OSC (open sound control) - Solo button in mixer doesn't respond to OSC message.

labels.name: UI
labels.description: Issues related to UI look&feel

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

labels.name: OSC
labels.description: Issues related to Open Sound Control (OSC) API

items.body:
**Bug Description:**
The solo button in the scene mixer doesn't respond to OSC messages.

**Surge XT Version**
Version: 1.3.0.20a8e16
Plugin Type: Standalone
Bitness: 64-bit

**Reproduction Steps:**
Send an OSC message to '/param/a/mixer/osc1/solo' with value 'True' or '1.0' (float). See also this python script:
```python
from osc4py3.as_eventloop import *
from osc4py3 import oscbuildparse as obp
from osc4py3.oscmethod import *

def set_mute():
    msg = obp.OSCMessage("/param/a/mixer/osc1/solo", ",f", [False])
    osc_send(msg, "oscout")
    osc_process()

### config
ip = "127.0.0.1"
surgeOSCInPort = 53210	#Surge XT default OSC in port

osc_startup()
osc_udp_client(ip, surgeOSCInPort, "oscout")

set_mute()

osc_terminate()

```

**Expected Behavior:**
The selected channel is solo'ed.


**Computer Information (please complete the following!):**
- OS: Mac OS 13.6.1
- Host: Standalone

**Additional Information:**
The solo button does correctly send its value over OSC when it is changed. The mute button works fine.

items.title: Clamp Twist oscillator's pitch input to ~2 Hz minimum
items.body: ...in order to avoid misbehavior in Harmonic mode, -3 octave offset and wide tunings like ED2-5.

items.title: Midi control over unison voices

labels.name: Feature Request
labels.description: New feature request

items.body: The whole front panel allows for midi control, except for the unison voices slider.

items.title: Defensive bipolar check in twist engine
items.body:
The twist engine lacked a defensive test for the bipolar detector which meant some automation events which didn't load an entire oscillator state could result in an out of boudns read.

Closes #7410

items.title: User-only on Cmd-Click od Cmd-Shift-F10 in patch browser
items.body: This change adds a user-only which skips factory and third party patches in the selection browser. Super useful for screen reader users getting to their own patches. Closes #7407

items.title: Fix the Tune button left click behavior
items.body: The way it was it always created the context menu no matter if you used left or right click. The way it used to work is once you have a tuning loaded, left click just toggles the tuning and you have to right click to get the context menu. If no tuning was loaded both left and right clicks would create the context menu. Now it works like that again.

items.title: OSC (open sound control) - /q/all_params can crash Surge XT on Mac

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

items.body:
**Bug Description:**
I'm the guy making a TouchOSC-template for Surge XT. Currently, to keep the TouchOSC interface in sync with Surge, I have to get a number of different params when changing oscillator types. This is because the osc-types have different controls for param 1-7 and so when changing osc-types I just query for all parameter info. 

When switching from osc-type 'String' to 'Twist', and immediately fetching all params, Surge will reliably crash on Mac OS.
I'm sending these OSC messages:
```
/param/a/osc/1/type 10
/q/all_params
```

Unfortunately I'm away from home right now and don't have a linux box on hand to test other setups.

**Surge XT Version**
* Version: 1.3.0.20a8e16
* Plugin Type: Standalone
* Bitness: 64-bit

**Reproduction Steps:**
As described, using TouchOS. 
In the testscript used by @pkstone, adding and running the following code will crash Surge.

```
def trigger_crash():
    msg = obp.OSCMessage("/param/a/osc/1/type", ",f", [9.0])
    osc_send(msg, "oscout")
    osc_process()
    
    msg = obp.OSCMessage("/param/a/osc/1/type", ",f", [10.0])
    osc_send(msg, "oscout")
    osc_process()
    
    msg = obp.OSCMessage("/q/all_params", ",", [])
    osc_send(msg, "oscout")
    osc_process()
```


**Expected Behavior:**
After changing the osc type, Surge sends OSC messages for all of its params.

**Computer Information (please complete the following!):**
 - OS: Mac OS 13.6.1
 - Host: Standalone

Attached is a crashlog generated by Mac OS.
[surge_crashlog_231225.txt](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/files/13767103/surge_crashlog_231225.txt)

items.title: Entire screen turns black

labels.name: UI
labels.description: Issues related to UI look&feel

labels.description: Issues which only occur on Linux

labels.name: Awaiting User Information
labels.description: Self-explanatory

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.x
milestone.description: Things we could do in the 1.x family but didn't make 1.2 or 1.3

items.body:
**Bug Description:**
When I run Surge XT 1.3, installed either from the official .deb or compiled and installed from github `main`, the whole screen turns black, the exception being some individual UI widgets which happen to repaint and thus appear. Mousing over widgets sometimes triggers a repaint and thus makes them visible, but this only lasts so long before everything draws as black again.

**Surge XT Version**
1.3.0 x86_64
2-bit or 64-bit]

**Reproduction Steps:**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

Run the app.

Wait about 15 seconds.

See the screen turn black.

Mouse over some widgets. They may appear.

Good luck exiting the app! (The x button is still active, if you can find it.)

**Expected Behavior:**
The app should display fully, without drawing the entire screen black.

**Screenshots:**
![image](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/assets/733906/6b67c209-d597-46d1-8894-92aa8d63be19)

**Computer Information (please complete the following!):**
 - OS: Linux Mint 21.2 x86_64 Cinnamon
 - Host: n/a
 - Version: 1.3.0

Happy to provide additional information.

items.title: Surge XT Amplifier ADSR Keyboard tracking

labels.name: Feature Request
labels.description: New feature request

items.body:
First post here: I hope that I haven't missed this feature in either the manual or a search of  the forum:

Thank you so much for this  truly amazing synth.

Would it please be possible to have Amplifier-specific ADSR Keyboard Tracking (not just VCF) added as a feature please?
This, to me, is such an important feature of realistic sound creation that seems to be implemented on so few synths.

Many thanks for any help/response,

MenoMosso

Note: I also have the latest Surge XT VST installed for use with Ableton, but that is outside scope here. Mentioning it in case you have some cross-over issue.

items.title: how does vst3 support mpe in ableton live?
items.body: i've been digging through the code and i can't figure this one out. when i load up surge as a vst3 in live i see it supports mpe because it has the mpe tag in the display: however, in a plugin i've created with juce, i cannot get "mpe" to display for vst3 (works fine with au/auv3). i found [this conversation](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/issues/3776) but didn't see any changes come out of it from your end. i noticed the rpn implementation but also that ableton doesn't call this so i'm guessing this isn't the issue? if you can offer any insight here it would be greatly appreciated, thanks!

items.body:
**Bug Description:**

Surge is not changing patches when sending Program Change messages from ReaControlMIDI inside REAPER.

**Surge XT Version**

Version: Surge XT 1.3.0.20a8e16
Build: 2023-12-08 @ 12:55:35 on 'fv-az390-357/pipeline' with 'MSVC-19.37.32826.1' using JUCE 7.0.5
System: Windows 64-bit CLAP on Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-10750H CPU @ 2.60GHz
Host: Reaper @ 44.1 kHz / Process block size: 32 samples

**Reproduction Steps:**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Set up patches in folder structure inside ...\Surge XT\Patches\MIDI Programs
2. Add instance of ReaControlMIDI to track.
3. Add instance of Surge (Clap) to track (after ReaControlMIDI).
4. In ReaControlMIDI, click "Load file" button and choose "GM.reabank".
5. In ReaControlMIDI, choose MIDI channel 1 at the top.
6. Use the Bank and Program dropdowns to send Program Change messages.
7. Surge does not respond to the Program Change messages.

**Expected Behavior:**
Surge should change patches as per the description in the 1.3 release notes.

**Screenshots:**

![image](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/assets/9380730/54ac6e8f-5261-4b34-918e-e6c0ccf1d24d)

**Computer Information (please complete the following!):**
 - OS: Windows 10
 - Host: REAPER 7.06

items.title: Surge XT 1.3.0 not found by any host

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

items.body:
**Bug Description:**
I had some trouble first installing the deb package in MX-21.3_x64 Wildflower as dpkg is yet not using zst compression. I repacked the deb with 

```
ar x nameofdebfile.deb
zstd -d < control.tar.zst | xz > control.tar.xz
zstd -d < data.tar.zst | xz > data.tar.xz
ar r surgenewdeb.deb debian-binary control.tar.xz data.tar.xz
```
Installation worked and the the files are under /lib/.vst3. 

However, Reaper and Bitwig do not find the vst3 plugin. Renoise lists it, but initialization fails. Clap version also doesn't work. 

**Surge XT Version**
1.3.0

* Version:

* Bitness: [64-bit]

see above

64

items.title: Bypass button in Surge XT Effects

labels.name: Feature Request
labels.description: New feature request

labels.name: FX Plugin
labels.description: Issues pertaining to Surge XT Effects plugin

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.x
milestone.description: Things we could do in the 1.x family but didn't make 1.2 or 1.3

items.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe!**
Many DAWs can bypass but perhaps not all of them, and some may behave badly. Many audio plugins have a bypass button in their GUI.

**Describe the solution you'd like:**
Ideally we'd connect to the bypass param but this is tricky: https://forum.juce.com/t/current-state-of-bypass-management/54662. Probably we will need to do what other plugins do and make it a seperate on/off switch like other plugins.

**Describe alternatives you've considered:**
Just leaving it up to the DAW.

**Additional context:**
This was a feature request on Facebook.

items.title: VST3 patch browser glitchy in Ableton + Wine

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

labels.name: Cannot Reproduce
labels.description: Issue that cannot be reproduced on our side, or user doesn't have a consistent reproducible case

items.body:
**Bug Description:**
In version 1.2.3 hovering on a category in the patch browser seems to randomly render the patches below the window, making it impossible to select a patch; occasionally, the submenu opens at the right level and displays items but clicking on the individual item still results in no selection. Patches can be selected by clicking on the arrows next to `category` and `patch`, and the rest of the UI seems to work normally (highlights where expected, controls behaving as expected).

In version 1.3.0, the GUI is frozen: patches can still be selected throught the `category` and `patch` arrows but there is no feedback of any kind (neither in the name nor in any of the controls) until the plugin window is closed and reopened.

**Surge XT Version**
* Version: 1.2.3, 1.3.0
* Plugin Type: VST3
* Bitness: 64-bit

**Reproduction Steps:**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Add plugin to track
2. Open plugin window
3. Attempt to select a patch with the browser, or edit a patch parameter/control
4. See error

**Expected Behavior:**
Active and properly updated GUI

**Screenshots:**

[surge1.2-patch-browser-glitches.webm](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/assets/2361956/6368c3cf-f34b-4bfe-8cd9-ae5e3aa5589f)
[surge1.3-GUI-not-updating.webm](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/assets/2361956/3154de52-83d3-4880-b34b-be57e80d5711)

**Computer Information (please complete the following!):**
 - OS: Linux Mint 21.2 (Cinnamon), wine-9.0-rc1 (Staging)
 - Host: Ableton Live (Win10 compatibility)
 - Version: 11.3.13

**Additional Information:**
Add any other context about the problem here.

items.title: CLAP and Reaper text input issue.

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

items.body:
**Bug Description:**
When using the CLAPi in Reaper and renaming a preset the space bar is captured and toggles playback instead of being used for naming. Normally handled by enabling a Reaper option "pass all keyboard input to plugin" but that is greyed out with the CLAPi version. This doesn't happen with the VST3i version or a CLAPi I tried from Full Bucket which implies this is specific to the CLAPi of Surge.

Oddly, I've found that I *can* enable the Reaper keyboard input option when I first load the CLAPi but haven't tried to edit anything. If I don't enable it and try to rename the preset it captures the space key as I described and the input option is greyed out in the FX container menu.

**Surge XT Version**
1.3.0

* Version:
* Plugin Type: CLAPi
* Bitness: 64

**Computer Information (please complete the following!):**
 - OS: Windows 10
 - Host: Reaper
 - Version: 7.06

I hope that's enough to go on. Let me know if you need more info or if it's something better brought up with the Reaper folks. Thanks.

items.title: Add new John Valentine patches
Lock parameters while changing patches

labels.name: Feature Request
labels.description: New feature request

labels.name: UX
labels.description: Issues related to user experience (UX) - mouse, touch, keyboard, MIDI inputs, etc.

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.x
milestone.description: Things we could do in the 1.x family but didn't make 1.2 or 1.3

items.body:
You know how many reverbs have a lock switch on the wet/dry param which prevents it from changing when you page through presets? User nicokaniac on Discord had the idea that it could be fun to have such a switch but that locks tempo-sync engaged on all relevant params, effectively rounding the saved value to a nearby tempo-synced one. 

It's an interesting idea. My thinking is for some parameters (EG's, Formula and MSEG Rate, maybe others too) it would be such a toss-up whether the tempo-sync rounding would sound cool or just break the patch completely that those should probably be omitted. But for delay times, sequencer rates, and most LFO rates, it might actually work great.

items.title: Comment out local only lines in Inno scripts
Replace the stock wizard image in Inno Setup with a cooler looking one
Release checklist for Surge XT 1.3.1
items.body:
Release label: XT 1.3.1
Link to milestone: https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/milestone/33

## Pre-Install

- [x] Address all open issues for the milestone
- [x] Update the changelog
- [x] Update the manual
- [x] Make sure the `CMakeLists.txt` version matches the version you are about to install

## Executing the Install

- [x] Update `releases-xt/azure-pipelines` so we don't get a tag conflict when the release happens even if it is just a bump commit
- [x] Create git markers in the `surge` repository
  - [x] Unlock your GPG key just in case, by running `gpg --output x.sig --sign CMakeLists.txt`
  - [x] Create a branch named `git checkout -b release-xt/1.3.1`
  - [x] Sign a tag with `git tag -s release_xt_1.3.1 -m "Create signed tag"`,
  - [x] Push both the branch and tag to upstream `git push --atomic upstream-write release-xt/x.y.z release_xt_1.3.1`

## Post-Install

- [x] Update and announce
   - [x] Update Homebrew [doc](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/tree/master/doc)
   - [x] Update [Winget manifest](https://github.com/microsoft/winget-pkgs) (`wingetcreate update --submit --urls https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/releases-xt/releases/download/1.3.1/surge-xt-win64-1.3.1-setup.exe --version x.y.z SurgeSynthTeam.SurgeXT`)
   - [x] Ping @luzpaz in https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/issues/7132
   - [x] Post to KvR thread, Facebook, Discord, etc.

items.title: Very small tweak for some OSC msgs
How do I interact with wavetable programmatically?

labels.name: Feature Request
labels.description: New feature request

items.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe!**

I'm experimenting with creating new synths programmatically, that involve inserting custom wavetables. However, it is not clear how to do this in Surge.

**Describe the solution you'd like:**
1) Ideally, there would be an XML format that captures the complete state of the synthesizer, nothing missing (https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/issues/6627)
The test suite for this could have scripts to roundtrip from FXP to XML and back, to make sure they are identical. I would be happy to contribute.
2) The Python API could be extended. If it is incomplete, an XML solution would be preferable.

**Describe alternatives you've considered:**
IDK.

**Additional context:**
I've made a lot of progress in getting AI to program synths, which I'll be sharing with the community soon, but wavetables is a missing link.

items.title: Bonsai: zero out `last` array on initialize()
Adds stub type definitions to surgepy. Fixes #7362
items.body:
I've manually ran `pybind11-stubgen surgepy` and added the resulting stubs to the surgepy package install routine. This is similar to how pybind11-stubgen author recommends these stubs be used; see https://github.com/sizmailov/pybind11-stubgen/issues/104#issuecomment-1706128213. 

It's possible there is a better way of accomplishing this, however I am very unfamiliar with skbuild.

items.title: Generate stub files for Python bindings

labels.name: Feature Request
labels.description: New feature request

items.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe!**
The python build process does not generate stub files, meaning developers using VS Code don't get autocomplete or inline documentation.

**Describe the solution you'd like:**
Running `pybind11-stubgen surgepy` and moving the contents of stubs/surgepy to inside the site-packages surgepy directory results in quite nice inline documentation. This should be added to build process, PR forthcoming.
![image](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/assets/50145113/1da20244-c834-419d-b938-59ff76e278ce)

**Describe alternatives you've considered:**
Tried to generate using mypy stubgen but it didn't work.

items.title: More Formula Subscription Changes: Timing and Voice
items.body:
1. Timing is always subscribed, including "release" which is whether the LFO is in the release phase

2. The voice subscription is (1) always on for voice, (2) always off for scene but (3) no matter what provides a state.is_voice which is true or false.
